unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: One-Sample T-Interval Output
question_text: An exercise physiologist is interested in the effect of exercise on heart rate. She has subjects walk slowly for $5\text{ minutes}$ and records their heart rates. Then she has the subjects run vigorously for $5\text{ minutes}$ and records their heart rates again. The differences are recorded (heart rate after running - heart rate before running), with results below: One-Sample T: Differences Test of $\mu$ = $0$ vs. > $0$ Variable N Mean StDev SE Mean 96% CI T P Differences 12 59.88 10.36 3.66 (51.22, 68.53) 16.35 0.000 What is a valid interpretation of the confidence interval given from the computer output?

choices.text: Since the entire interval does not contain 0 0 , there is evidence the heart rate increased after exercise.
The increase in heart rate is probably somewhere around 16 16 beats per minute.
Since the entire interval is above 0 0 , there is evidence the heart rate increased after exercise.
Since the p p -value is not captured in the interval, there is evidence the heart rate increased after exercise.
Since the p p -value is not captured in the interval, there is no evidence heart rate increased after exercise.
